title: My phone is being spy by my husband. How can I remove whatever spying app he has on it? - Quora

response.answer_text: What are you trying to hide from your husband? Don’t give me this bullshit, “I want my privacy as a principle.” I have absolutely no secrets from my wife. She has the passcode to my phone. In fact, she has the password to every account I have. Banking, email, social networking - everything. If you have nothing to hide, you have nothing to worry about with a spying app. Keep in mind, these apps are designed not to be detected, so the only way to get rid of it is to wipe your phone and NOT restore it from a backup.

It is unlikely he has any software on your phone to spy on you, especially if it’s an iPhone. Far more likely, he has figured out your passcode, or he has seen you enter it. Anytime he has access to your phone, when your sleeping, when you’re in the shower, whatever, he gets it and reads whatever he wants. Change your passcode to something only you know, and ensure he’s not watching you enter the new one, and don’t tell anybody about the new code.
For android or Apple the best way is reset or reset your phone ( note: do not restore your phone from a backup) then set the phone up as new ( with Android I have used a new email in the past.

factory reset, and you dont reinstall any backup of your installed app. best thing: save photos, files, music on a cloud, factory reset and reinstall manually the apps you wish to have on your device. however if your husband installed a spy app there seems to be serious relationship issues. might be importante to face those first
